ETYMOLOGY: From Old English 'topp' (summit, tuft of hair), related to Old Norse 'toppr' and Old High German 'zopf'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (such as a person, place, or thing) that is used to identify any of a class of people or things or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The highest or uppermost point, part, or surface of something.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某物的最高点、最上部或表面。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She placed the book on the top of the shelf.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她把书放在书架的最上面。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word that describes a noun or pronoun.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Of the highest or most superior kind, position, or quality; excellent.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 最高级别的，最重要的，或质量最好的；杰出的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He is a top student in his class.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word or phrase that describes an action, condition, or experience, taking a direct object.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To place something on the top of something else; to surpass, exceed, or be higher than.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 将某物置于另一物之上；超越、胜过或高于。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She topped the cake with fresh berries. | Her latest novel topped all the best-seller lists.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她在蛋糕上放了新鲜的浆果。| 她的最新小说荣登所有畅销书榜首。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (such as a person, place, or thing) that is used to identify any of a class of people or things or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A garment worn on the upper part of the body.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She bought a new summer top.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她买了一件新的夏季上衣。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (such as a person, place, or thing) that is used to identify any of a class of people or things or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A child's toy that spins rapidly on a point.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种儿童玩具，能在尖端上快速旋转。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The child played with his spinning top.
